Class Maze

  • java.lang.Object
    • Maze

  • public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates and traverses the maze
    Author:
    rbanda

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private char[][] mazeArray
      This variable holds the maze
      private int move
      This variable holds the number of moves

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Maze(int xPos, int yPos)
      This method calls the traverse maze function if maze cannot be traversable it prints out no solution

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean exitMaze(int xPos, int yPos)
      This method sees if it is at the exit or not
      private void mazePrint()
      This method reprints the maze to the console
      boolean traverse(char[][] array, int xPos, int yPos)
      This method tries to traverse the maze by recursively calling itself if maze cannot be traversable it returns false
      boolean validMove(int xPos, int yPos)
      This method sees if the move is valid if move is not valid it returns false

    • Method Detail

      • traverse

        public boolean traverse(char[][] array,
                        int xPos,
                        int yPos)
        This method tries to traverse the maze by recursively calling itself if maze cannot be traversable it returns false
        Parameters:
        array[][] - Takes in the maze
        xPos - Takes in the xpos
        yPos - Takes in the ypos
        Returns:
        boolean returns false if maze is not traversable returns true if mase is traversable

      • validMove

        public boolean validMove(int xPos,
                         int yPos)
        This method sees if the move is valid if move is not valid it returns false
        Parameters:
        xPos - Takes in the xpos
        yPos - Takes in the ypos
        Returns:
        boolean returns true or false if the move is valid or not

      • exitMaze

        This method sees if it is at the exit or not
        Parameters:
        xPos - Takes in the xpos
        yPos - Takes in the ypos
        Returns:
        boolean returns true or false if at the exit
